title: cifti-rois-from-extrema
description:
CREATE CIFTI ROI MAPS FROM EXTREMA MAPS.

For each nonzero value in each map, make a map with an ROI around that location.  If the -gaussian option is specified, then normalized gaussian kernels are output instead of ROIs.  The <method> argument to -overlap-logic must be one of ALLOW, CLOSEST, or EXCLUDE.  ALLOW is the default, and means that ROIs are treated independently and may overlap.  CLOSEST means that ROIs may not overlap, and that no ROI contains vertices that are closer to a different seed vertex.  EXCLUDE means that ROIs may not overlap, and that any vertex within range of more than one ROI does not belong to any ROI.

surf-limit.description: geodesic distance limit from vertex, in mm

vol-limit.description: euclidean distance limit from voxel center, in mm

direction.description: which dimension an extrema map is along, ROW or COLUMN

surf-sigma.description: the sigma for the surface gaussian kernel, in mm

vol-sigma.description: the sigma for the volume gaussian kernel, in mm

anyOf.description: generate gaussian kernels instead of flat ROIs

gaussian.description: generate gaussian kernels instead of flat ROIs

method.description:
how to handle overlapping ROIs, default ALLOW

the method of resolving overlaps

surface.description:
specify the left surface to use

the left surface file

merged-volume.description: treat volume components as if they were a single component
